county assessor.description: A county assessor determines the value of properties within a jurisdiction for property tax purposes, ensuring assessments are fair and accurate according to current market values and property characteristics. This role involves managing property records, addressing taxpayer inquiries, and overseeing appeals related to property valuations.

pfms.attributes: Address disparities in property tax burdens; Advocate for property tax legislation changes; Implement fair assessment practices; Address under-assessment, gentrification; Promote diversity and inclusion
Inform the public on changes to the assessment process; Enhance public education of the assessment process

Navigate historic property issues, political pressures; Address the impact of natural disasters on property value; Utilize new technology in assessments; Accurate property records, databases, valuations of complex commercial property assessments; Balance between rural and urban

Enforce compliance with State and Federal tax laws; Coordinate with local governments, other counties, and federal agencies; Coordinate with other counties on assessment standards; Address property tax delinquency, property tax exemptions issues; Implement ethical standards, best practices from other jurisdictions

Adapt to legislative changes affecting property taxes; Adapt to changes in property values due to market fluctuations; Address the impact of zoning changes on property values; Address the impact of economic downturns on property values; Addres the challenges of rapidly changing neighborhoods
Develop a user-friendly assessor's website; Ensure the continuity of operations during emergencies; Ensure the accessibility for individuals with disabilities in the assessment process
Consider environmental concerns in property assessments; Reduce waste in the assessor's office; Promote sustainable development through assessments
Engage with community organizations; Engage with public on proposed assessment changes; Manage public expectations on property taxes; Public Relations
Balance budget constraints, Address taxpayer concerns efficiently, Enhance collaboration with real estate professionals
Ensure the security of sensitive property data, Address cases of fraud and abuse, Identify and resolve conflicts of interest
Streamline the assessment appeal process, Handle appeals against property valuations, Manage the workload of assessment appeals

county director of elections.description: A county director of elections oversees the administration of electoral processes within a county, ensuring that elections are conducted fairly, efficiently, and in compliance with relevant laws and regulations. This includes managing voter registration, polling places, election personnel, and the tabulation of votes.

pfms.attributes: Ensure integrity of ballot counting process, voter registration list; Monitor for insider threats, tampering; Implement voter ID laws; Conduct post-election audits

Update security measures, secure electoral databases; Monitor election activities near polling places; Ensure the physical security of election materials; Protect election systems against cyber threats and hacking attempts
Coordinate with law enforcement for public safety, Ensure the privacy and confidentiality of votes

Preserve election records; Manage logistics of mail-in ballots, voter verification, remote and rural areas, training of poll workers and volunteers; Develop contingency plans for machine malfunctions, power outages, disasters, emergencies, pandemics; Provide sufficient voting machines; Budget for election operations
Foster sustainable election operations, Minimize mail-in voting waste
Foster integrity among staff, Adopt new voting technology appropriately, Ensure compliance with federal, state, local election laws, regulations
Engage with marginalized communities, young voters, political parties, candidates, academic and research institutions; Enhance voter education; Keep public informed of election information

Maintain user-friendly website with election information; Ensure availability polling places to those with disabilities, language barriers, overseas, marginalized communities; Foster equitable access to electronic voting; Implement early and absentee/mail-in voting systems
Navigate legal challenges to election procedures and results; Handle electoral disputes and challenges; manage recounts and run-off elections; Crackdown on misinformation and disinformation campaigns
Coordinate with media for election coverage; Manage public expectations in the election process; Outline relationships with third party entities and technology companies
Facilitate participation of independent and third-party candidates; Address partisan pressures; Maintain neutrality

county council.description: A county council member is responsible for legislating local policies, ordinances, and budgets to address the needs and welfare of the county's residents. They also oversee the management and allocation of county resources, including infrastructure, public services, and development projects.

pfms.attributes: Domestic violence services and prevention; Gun control and safety measures; Public safety and crime reduction
Roads, bridges, public buildings; Public Wi-Fi and broadband access; Public libraries and cultural services
Traffic congestion and safety, Walkable infrastructure, Light rail, Subways, Bus lines, Bicycle infrastructure
Climate change measures; Renewable energy initiatives; Animal control; Waste management, recycling programs; Water quality, Air quality
Tax policy; Tourism; Small business support
Childcare; Education funding; Youth programs
Partnership with local schools and universities; Local media support; Parks and recreational facilities; Neighborhood revitalization; Historic and cultural heritage preservation
Mental health services; Drug abuse prevention and rehabilitation; Affordable housing
Eldercare, Veterans' services, Immigration support, Disability services, Affordable legal services, Public health initiatives, Emergency medical services, disaster preparedness
Law enforcement transparency; Voter access, election integrity
Regulation of new technologies and industries; Zoning urban, residential, agricultural, rural; Privacy and data protection for residents
Support for non-profit organizations, food banks, community groups, arts and creative industries; LGBTQ+, Racial equity; Community policing

port commissioner.description: A port commissioner oversees the operations and development of a port, making decisions related to budget, policies, and strategic planning to ensure the port's efficiency, security, and economic viability. They may also be involved in environmental and community relations issues related to port activities.

pfms.attributes: maritime safety, fishery management, harbor maintenance, navigational aids, dredging projects, pilotage services, vessel tracking systems
commercial fishing interests; alternative revenue streams; trade and private-public partnerships, job creation, global supply chain resiliency, market analysis and strategy
air quality standards, water quality monitoring, noise reduction, renewable energy use, carbon emissions reduction, wildlife conservation, coastal erosion management
port security, cybersecurity, crisis management, hazardous materials handling, international compliance, immigration and customs facilitation
seafood export, intermodal, and parking facilities; infrastructure and technology upgrades; competitive tendering processes; warehousing, clean technology investment

union relations; public relations; international representation; waterfront access; tourist services; indigenous community relations; educational programs; recreational spaces; stakeholder communication; accessibility

open data policies; transparent governance; disaster preparedness; fair labor practices; land use planning; real estate development; historical preservation; financial audits, anti-corruption measures
competitive pricing; customer satisfaction; food and beverage concessions; ferry, yacht, and marina services; recreational boating facilities
customs, aviation, and transportation link efficiency; cruise terminal operations, traffic flow management, cargo throughput, freight logistics

city council.description: A city council person participates in the legislative body of a city, responsible for making decisions, passing ordinances, and setting policies that affect local governance. They also address constituents' needs, represent their interests, and work on local development projects.

pfms.attributes: Affordable utilities, public services, housing; tenant protections; emergency relief; public health screening and research
mental health preventative programs and crisis response services; drug abuse rehabilitation initiatives
disaster preparation initiatives, emergency services, and climate resilience planning
police accountability and reform; protections for non-violent and first-time offenders
street and graffiti cleanup, loitering, theft, and open drug use enforcement; increased investigation efforts
cyclist incentives; bus lanes and support; railways, subway, and tram initiatives
electric grid, water system, and high-speed internet initiatives; road and sidewalk repair; replacement of hazardous infrastructure
local tax reform and small business initiatives, business district and profitable development initiatives
school partnerships, community outreach programs and civic engagement; museum and library funding;
animal and noxious weed control; local wildlife and ecosystem protections; expanded recycling initiatives; energy use and water use regulations, green space management and initiatives
urban agriculture, long-term architecture, and sustainable construction initiatives, pedestrian and cyclist-friendly infrastructure, community conscientious development
experimental and alternative zoning permissions, building height regulations, zoning for families and local businesses
Transparent election data and city decisions; public official accountability; prudent city budget allocation

mayor.description: A mayor serves as the chief executive officer of a city or town, responsible for overseeing the municipal government's operations and implementing its laws and policies. They also represent the community, manage public services, and work with city councils to develop and achieve strategic goals.

pfms.attributes: Improve police-community relations; Ensure safe public spaces; Preemptive crime targeting
Enhance the quality of public education; Increase funding for schools, youth programs and activities; Access to child care
Natural disaster and emergency infrastructure; Repair roads, bridges, sidewalks; Improve access to high-speed internet and digital services.
Affordable housing; Access to healthy food; Expand programs for substance abuse prevention, mental health services, treatment
Promote green initiatives, energy conservation, renewable energy projects; Improve waste management, air quality, animal control and welfare services; Reduce carbon emissions; Ensure clean water
Expand public transit options, bus-lines, walking and cycling infrastructure; Reduce traffic and congestion
Provide training and job skills education programs; Senior services and protections; Immigrant integration services; Veteran support; Accessible facilities for disabled people
Support for small businesses, sister city partnerships, foreign investment; Create job opportunities, tourist attractions; Efficient usage of city resources; Balanced tax policies
Sustainable urban growth; Encourage development; Preserve community character
Open governance; Encourage citizen participation in government
Promote urban agriculture, arts, culture, cultural festivals, community events, historical preservation; Expand and provide public library services; Maintain parks and recreational facilities

school district director.description: A school district director oversees the administration of schools within a specific district, focusing on implementing educational policies, curriculum standards, and managing budget allocations to ensure a high-quality education for all students. They also work with the community, staff, and other stakeholders to address educational goals and challenges.

pfms.attributes: STEM and digital literacy initiatives; reading, arts and humanities; foreign language programs; gifted programs, college readiness, and standardized test prep; tutoring
teacher retention, evaluation, accountability, and incentives; professional development for staff
class size reduction; distance learning and mental health support; special education and social-emotional learning; counseling services; physical education; dropout prevention
library and media services; grants; technology upgrades; school infrastructure
sustainable lunches; food systems education, increased nutritional quality and availability of school lunches
racial, gender, LGBTQ+, and disability equity; diverse, culturally sensitive faculties; bilingual education; anti-discriminatory and open enrollment policies
security, anti-bullying programs, conflict resolution training, student discipline policies, lock-down and emergency preparedness
district rezoning, school start times, bus and transit services, parental and alumni engagement, community partnerships, parent-teacher communication, school board relations, community outreach
financial literacy, life skills, and early childhood education; adult education programs; student-led initiatives; internship and apprenticeship programs; summer school and remedial programs
extracurricular, after-school, athletic, music, and arts programs
transparency and accountability; student privacy and data protection; public relations; ethical conduct and governance
school dress codes, textbook and material selection, drug and alcohol education, homework, attendance, and zero-tolerance policies
